title: How to Remove a Blood Spot from a Cotton Pillow Case

steps.title: Fill a sink or a bucket with cold water.
steps.content: Fill a sink or a bucket with cold water. Put the cotton Pillowcase inside to completely saturate it.

steps.title: Hold the areas of the Pillowcase near the blood spot with each hand, then rub against each other to help loosen the blood.
steps.content: Hold the areas of the Pillowcase near the blood spot with each hand, then rub against each other to help loosen the blood.

steps.title: Lay out the Pillowcase on a work area.
steps.content: Lay out the Pillowcase on a work area.

steps.title: Pour some table salt or meat tenderizer on the blood spot and allow to settle for about 20 minutes.
steps.content: Pour some table salt or meat tenderizer on the blood spot and allow to settle for about 20 minutes. This should normally remove much, if not all, of the blood from the fabric.

steps.title: Rinse the fabric under cold running water.
steps.content: Rinse the fabric under cold running water.

steps.title: Pour a small dollop of shampoo or dishwashing detergent over the spot.
steps.content: Pour a small dollop of shampoo or dishwashing detergent over the spot.

steps.title: Repeat the rubbing of the soiled portion of the fabric against each other, as with step 2.
steps.content: Repeat the rubbing of the soiled portion of the fabric against each other, as with step 2.

steps.title: Rinse the fabric under cold running water.
steps.content: Rinse the fabric under cold running water.

steps.title: When the blood spot is completely gone, launder the Pillowcase as usual.
steps.content: When the blood spot is completely gone, launder the Pillowcase as usual.

steps.title: Lay out the Pillowcase on a work area.
steps.content: Lay out the Pillowcase on a work area.

steps.title: Pour hydrogen peroxide directly on the blood spot.
steps.content: Pour hydrogen peroxide directly on the blood spot. Usually, a solution with 3% strength would suffice.

steps.title: Let the hydrogen peroxide fizz or bubble for a few minutes, to allow the chemical to react to the blood spot and break it down.
steps.content: Let the hydrogen peroxide fizz or bubble for a few minutes, to allow the chemical to react to the blood spot and break it down. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Blot with a damp sponge or cloth.
steps.content: Blot with a damp sponge or cloth. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat steps 2 to 4 until the blood spot is removed.
steps.content: Repeat steps 2 to 4 until the blood spot is removed.

steps.title: Launder the Pillowcase as usual, in cold water.
steps.content: Launder the Pillowcase as usual, in cold water. Alternatively, you can take it to a professional who can clean it with a blood and protein remover known as BPR. [3] X Expert Source Robert Shapiro Laundry Specialist Expert Interview. 24 August 2021.
